questions.question: He tried hard ……………………… he could not succeed.
questions.description: However is not a conjunction it cannot connect two clauses.

questions.question: …………………………… she is beautiful, she is not very popular among her friends.
questions.description: We use though to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: ………………………….. being pretty, she was never really popular.
questions.description: In spite of is a preposition. It is followed by a noun.

questions.question: …………………………. rich, they lived a privileged life.
You must leave now ……………………….. I will call the police.
He bought the land …………………………… belonged to his neighbor.
questions.description: The relative pronoun which refers to things. That can also be used with this meaning.

questions.question: ……………………….. the inflation, the economy is showing signs of growth.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. It is used before a noun.

questions.question: It is a pity ………………………….. he should die so young.
…………………………….. you wait for an hour or so you will be able to meet him.
We travelled all the way to Agra …………………………. we could see Taj Mahal.
The man was so generous ……………………… everyone respected him.
